snippet: It’s bad for the climate, and American taxpayers are being shortchanged.
abstract: Op-Ed article by physicist Michael Riordan argues against proposed selling of government subsidized coal to Asian countries; warns that sales, in addition to damaging environment at home and abroad, will promote continued transfer of industrial work to Asia; decries fact that coal is extracted cheaply, costing taxpayer dollars and lining pockets of companies involved in global supply chain.
lead_paragraph: It’s bad for the climate, and American taxpayers are being shortchanged.

headline.main: Don’t Sell Cheap U.S. Coal to Asia
